author: Philip Aldrick
description: Rachel Reeves should keep the UK’s £20,000 annual limit on tax-free cash ISA savings because cutting it will not lift growth but will push up mortgage costs, an influential group of lawmakers said.
title: Don’t Cut Cash ISA Limit, UK Lawmakers Warn Reeves

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump will look to sign economic agreements and critical minerals deals with trading partners during his trip to Asia, according to senior US officials, as the administration moves to ramp up pressure on China ahead of a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Aims to Sign Mineral Deals in Asia to Raise Pressure on Xi

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: The US spent an amount well in excess of $1 billion this month acquiring Argentine pesos, according to market estimates, as Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s backstop effort intensified ahead of the Oct. 26 midterm vote.
title: Bessent’s Intervention in Argentine Peso Soars Past $1 Billion

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Face-to-face encounter follows escalation of trade tensions.
title: Trump and Xi to Meet With Stakes High for Both

author: Lydia Beyoud, Josh Wingrove, Bernard Goyder
description: President Donald Trump has picked Michael Selig to chair the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, according to an administration official, who asked not to be identified discussing personnel matters.
title: Trump to Pick Michael Selig for CFTC Chair Amid Crypto Expansion

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump’s administration sanctioned Colombia’s president and members of his inner circle for alleged drug trafficking, intensifying the clash between the two countries.
title: Trump Sanctions Colombia President as Relations Sour Further

author: Erik Larson
description: A slate of prominent economists from across the political spectrum, including former Federal Reserve Chairs Ben Bernanke and Janet Yellen, urged the US Supreme Court to overturn most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs, saying they’re based on misconceptions about the global economy.
title: Trump Tariffs Panned by Bernanke, Yellen in Supreme Court Filing

author: Thomas Seal, Stephanie Hughes
description: The Ontario government plans to run the anti-tariff advertisement that irked US President Donald Trump during the US broadcast of baseball’s World Series.
title: Ontario to Run Trade Ad That Angered Trump During World Series

author: Alicia Diaz
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries endorsed New York City’s Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, throwing the weight of one of the highest-ranking party members behind the Queens assemblyman.
title: Mamdani Receives Long-Awaited Jeffries Endorsement for NYC Mayor

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio expressed cautious optimism on the implementation of President Donald Trump’s peace agreement that’s come under strain from bloodshed in Gaza and political intrigue in Jerusalem during a visit to a new led-US command center in southern Israel.
title: Rubio Visits Gaza Command Hub in Israel to Reinforce Peace Plan

author: Pius Lukong
description: Cameroon’s top court has rejected a petition by an opposition party, alleging discrepancies in vote count in this month’s presidential elections.
title: Cameroon Top Court Rejects Fresh Allegation of Vote Irregularity

author: Olga Kharif, Ryan Weeks
description: Hours after receiving a pardon from President Donald Trump, Binance Holdings Ltd.’s billionaire co-founder Changpeng Zhao issued a thank-you message mid-flight — and signaled his renewed ambitions for the world’s largest crypto exchange.
title: Binance’s CZ Prepares for Second Act as Trump Wipes Slate Clean

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK’s top prosecutor reiterated his argument that Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government was to blame for the collapse of a case against two men accused of spying for China.
title: UK Prosecutor Hits Back at Government Over Collapsed Spy Case

author: Ari Natter, Ruth Liao
description: US Secretary of the Interior Doug Burgum floated the concept of storing natural gas produced in Alaska’s North Slope and shipping it directly from there, a proposal he said has drawn interest from unnamed foreign investors.
title: Interior’s Burgum Floats Shipping Gas From Alaska North Slope

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration is launching a trade investigation that opens the door to new tariffs on Chinese goods, ratcheting up tensions ahead of a highly anticipated summit next week between the countries’ leaders.
title: US Launches Fresh China Tariff Probe Ahead of Trump-Xi Meeting

author: Gregory Korte, Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon said it received an anonymous $130 million donation to pay the military during the US government shutdown, a move the administration might not legally be able to carry out.
title: Pentagon Received $130 Million Anonymous Gift to Pay Troops

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: A group of men at the center of an arson attack backed by Russia’s Wagner Group targeting a London warehouse that supplied goods to Ukraine were sentenced to as long as 17 years in jail.
title: Wagner-Backed Group Jailed for Arson Attack on London Firm

author: Chris Strohm, Jimmy Jenkins
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James pleaded not guilty on Friday to criminal charges that she committed bank fraud and made false statements to a lender when she bought a house in Norfolk, Virginia, five years ago.
title: NY Attorney General James Pleads Not Guilty to US Charges

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu announced a shakeup of his top defense officers on Friday.
title: Nigeria’s President Names New Defense Chiefs, Official Says

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Manuela Tobias
description: Sus recortes presupuestarios han golpeado duramente a la clase media de Argentina. Por esto, el presidente libertario corre el riesgo de convertirse en un político sin poder en las cruciales elecciones de mitad de mandato de este fin de semana.
title: La motosierra de Milei enfurece a los votantes que necesita para sobrevivir

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Manuela Tobias
description: Spending cuts hit the middle class hard, leaving the libertarian at risk of becoming a lame duck after this weekend’s crucial midterm election.
title: Milei’s Chainsaw Infuriates Voters He Needs to Salvage His Presidency

author: Anna Edgerton
description: Seattle is about to find out how progressive it really is as a surprisingly close mayoral election pits the moderate incumbent against a community organizer campaigning to raise taxes on companies and wealthy residents.
title: Mamdani-Like Contender Tests Seattle’s Breaking Point on Taxes

author: Katia Porzecanski
description: The New York Knicks sent Zohran Mamdani, the frontrunner in next month’s mayoral election, a cease-and-desist for the use of the team’s iconic logo in his campaign ad.
title: Knicks Tell Mamdani to Stop Using Team Logo in Campaign Ad

author: Andrew Kreighbaum
description: The Department of Homeland Security will require all immigrants and non-citizens to be photographed when entering and leaving the US under new regulations released Friday.
title: US to Photograph All Non-Citizens Entering, Exiting Country

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Mounting Ukrainian drone attacks in Russia are prompting President Vladimir Putin to tap a source of additional troops to try to protect vital infrastructure.
title: Putin Calls Up Reserves to Protect Russia From Ukraine’s Drones

author: Vinicius Andrade, Nicolle Yapur, Maria Elena Vizcaino
description: It’s going to be a pivotal moment for the Milei trade — and nobody wants to be caught on the wrong side of it again.
title: Wall Street Is Wary of Being Burned by the ‘Milei Trade’ Again

author: Francine Lacqua
description: Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said he hopes that Europe can overcome trade difficulties with China, but should be ready to take firm action if necessary.
title: Bundesbank Head Says EU Must Be Ready to Retaliate Against China

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Zohran Mamdani, the frontrunner for New York mayor in next month’s election, wants to simplify the city’s permitting process to make it easier for organizations to host street events — a tightly regulated process under current rules that typically requires paying an assortment of fees.
title: Mamdani Wants to Simplify Permits, Cut Red Tape Before World Cup

author: Courtney McBride
description: The US military struck another purported drug-trafficking vessel in the Caribbean, killing six people, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Friday.
title: US Strikes Another Alleged Drug Boat in Caribbean, Killing Six

author: Ari Altstedter
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford appeared to stand by a television ad that angered Donald Trump and prompted the US president to call a halt to trade talks with Canada.
title: Ontario Premier Stands By Reagan Ad After Trump Cancels Trade Talks

author: Jordan Fabian, Jarrell Dillard
description: The US government will probably be unable to release inflation data for October, the White House said Friday, citing the ongoing government shutdown.
title: October Inflation Data Unlikely to Be Released, White House Says

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Three weeks shy of Chile’s presidential election, key figures from the center-left political class that governed for most of the prosperous post-dictatorship era are reaching across the aisle to back the only candidate they say can save the country from dangerous extremes.
title: Chile’s Moderate Candidate Clinches Support of Center-Left Stars

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Alex Wickham, Alberto Nardelli, Eric Martin
description: For months, President Donald Trump resisted calls to slap new sanctions on Russia, believing he could end the war in a deal with Vladimir Putin — including with a quick peace summit in the coming weeks in Budapest.
title: Trump's Sudden Shift on Putin Spurred by Russia Critic Rubio

author: Ana Monteiro, Francine Lacqua
description: South Africa is pushing to deport more undocumented migrants who compete with citizens for jobs in an economy with one of the highest unemployment rates globally, the minister overseeing the program said.
title: South Africa Boosts Deportations Amid Jobs Crisis, Minister Says

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italy is readying a 12th military aid package for Ukraine, focusing on munitions and SAMP/T missiles for air defense systems, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Italy Readies 12th Ukraine Aid Package on Munitions and Air Defense

author: Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has repeatedly ruled out tax hikes to help reduce her nation’s fiscal deficit. But a slew of new levies are hiding in plain sight in a 2026 budget blueprint her ruling Morena party is pushing through Congress.
title: Mexico Poised for Tax Hikes Sheinbaum Once Said Wouldn’t Happen

author: Brendan Murray
description: Political advertisements have a long history of taking liberties in how they use material to pack a punch. A Canadian television ad that selectively picked passages from a 1987 radio address by former President Ronald Reagan did that and more.
title: How the Ontario Reagan Ad Sliced and Diced the Original Address

author: Shruti Srivastava, Swati Gupta
description: India is close to finalizing a trade deal with the United States, as both sides near agreement on most issues, a government official said, even as the trade minister emphasized New Delhi will not rush into any pact.
title: India Close to US Trade Deal Even as Minister Says it Won’t Rush

description: A dispute between rival traders is causing trouble for the oil business that Moscow built to keep the pumps working following Western sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine
title: Russia’s Oil Business Takes a Hit From Fight Between Top Traders

author: Arne Delfs, Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul canceled his first official trip to China just two days before he was set to depart, citing scheduling issues.
title: Germany’s Top Diplomat Pulls Out of China Trip at Last Minute

author: William Horobin
description: France’s Socialist Party said it’s prepared to bring down the fragile minority government as soon as next week if there is no significant increase in taxation in next year’s budget.
title: France’s Socialists Threaten to Topple Government in Tax Debate

author: Anup Roy
description: India’s shift away from discounted Russian crude should be more than offset by gains from likely lower US tariffs, Nomura Holdings Inc. said Friday.
title: Lower US Tariffs to Offset India’s Russia Oil Shift, Nomura Says

author: Jennah Haque, Elena Mejia, Laura Nahmias, Rafael Garcia
description: For the full experience visit: Here’s Where NYC Mayoral Candidates Stand on Key Issues
title: Here’s Where NYC Mayoral Candidates Stand on Key Issues

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Almost half the seats in Congress are up for grabs in elections with outsized meaning.
title: Argentina Decides on Milei’s Chainsaw Politics

author: Colum Murphy, Amber Tong
description: President Xi Jinping’s stranglehold on rare earths will give China unprecedented leverage to win concessions from the US during talks this weekend in Kuala Lumpur. Sitting in Beijing’s reserve is control over an even more vital supply chain: medicine.
title: China’s Pharma Leverage Is ‘Nuclear Option’ in US Trade Talks

author: Stephen Stapczynski
description: A liquefied natural gas tanker off Malaysia that appears to be receiving fuel from a sanctioned Russian vessel is owned by Chinese shipping firm Pacific Gas, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: China’s Pacific Gas Owns LNG Ship Skirting Russian Sanctions

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chilean presidential front-runners Jeannette Jara and José Antonio Kast both suffered significant drops in voting intentions, according to a new poll published less than a month before the first round.
title: Chile Presidential Front-Runners See Falling Support in New Poll

author: Andrew Rosati
description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is riding high as the most popular major president in South America thanks to a boost from Donald Trump and support for his efforts to fight inequality with higher taxes on the rich.
title: Lula Is South America’s Most Popular President as Rivals Fade

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s approval rating fell to its lowest level in October since he took office as economic expectations remained negative and corruption topped voters’ concerns.
title: Milei Approval Rating Hits New Low Before Midterms, Poll Finds

author: Galit Altstein, Ethan Bronner
description: Two years ago, after Hamas killed and kidnapped its way across southern Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemed finished. “Mr. Security,” as he billed himself, would either resign in shame or be driven out by a devastated public.
title: Netanyahu Eyes 2026 Election With Pitch That He Saved Israel

author: Laura Noonan
description: Regulators in the US are pushing ahead with their challenge to a twist in global bank capital rules that favors Europe’s largest lenders, despite recently rubber-stamping the arrangements for 2025.
title: Fed Asks for Rethink of Capital Rules That Favored BNP Paribas

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Beninese Finance Minister Romuald Wadagni and the leader of a small opposition party were the only two candidates accepted by the West African nation’s electoral commission to run in next year’s presidential race.
title: Benin Finance Minister Has Single Opponent in Presidential Vote

author: Firat Kozok
description: A Turkish court dropped a case that could topple the leader of the country’s main opposition party, offering temporary relief to investors concerned about renewed political instability.
title: Turkish Court Dismisses Case Against Opposition in Markets Boost

author: Hyonhee Shin, Shinhye Kang
description: South Korea and the US remain “sharply” divided over the cash portion of a $350 billion investment pledge, South Korea’s Industry Minister Kim Jung-kwan said Friday, hinting that a deal may not be reached in time for a summit meeting.
title: Korea, US Still ‘Sharply’ Split Over Cash in $350 Billion Pledge

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he expects to meet with President Donald Trump in Malaysia this weekend to discuss any topic, including the US administration’s controversial use of military strikes against alleged drug shipments coming from Venezuela.
title: Lula Aims for Trump Talks in Asia, Open to Discuss Venezuela

author: Jennifer Duggan
description: Ireland is set to elect a new president, with a left-leaning candidate holding a sizable lead in opinion polls.
title: Ireland Set to Choose New President With Left Ahead in Polls

author: Tugce Ozsoy
description: Investors in Turkey are awaiting yet another court verdict on the fate of the main opposition party on Friday, in a case that could once again escalate political tensions in the country.
title: Turkey Investors Await Court Verdict on Main Opposition Party

author: Weilun Soon
description: The US government jolted energy markets when it sanctioned Russia’s two biggest crude oil producers on Oct. 22. All eyes are now on how the sanctions will affect the supply and price of petroleum across the world.
title: Understanding the Latest US Sanctions on Russian Oil

author: Lucille Liu
description: China’s Commerce Minister struck an optimistic tone on talks with the US, saying Beijing and Washington can find solutions ahead of key trade negotiations between the two countries.
title: China Commerce Minister Says US and China Can Find Solutions

author: Kamailoudini Tagba, Moses Mozart Dzawu
description: Ouattara’s main rivals have been barred from contesting vote
title: Ivory Coast Democracy Strained by Leader’s Bid for Fourth Term

author: William Standring
description: Plaid Cymru won a special election for the Welsh Parliament, delivering a blow to the UK’s governing Labour Party, which had never before lost in the Caerphilly seat.
title: Welsh Nationalists Win Senedd By-Election in Blow to Starmer

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama signaled that it may be necessary to issue additional debt to fund Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s upcoming economic package, if existing resources prove insufficient.
title: Japan’s Finance Minister Signals Possibility of More JGB Sales

author: Derek Wallbank
description: US President Donald Trump said he would immediately halt all trade negotiations with Canada.
title: Trump Says All Trade Talks With Canada Are Terminated

author: Sakura Murakami, Akemi Terukina
description: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi is set to address parliament for the first time as prime minister, in a speech that will likely prioritize tackling a cost-of-living crunch and bolstering defense ahead of a visit by US President Donald Trump next week.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Expected to Bolster Inflation Response, Defense
